snippet: A once powerful Chongqing police official, Wang Lijun, is accused of defection, abuse of power and corruption, China’s state media reported.
abstract: Wang Lijun, once-powerful police officer at center of a scandal that felled the senior Chinese Communist leader Bo Xilai, is charged with defection, abuse of power and corruption; charges stem from his flight in February to the United States Consulate in Chengdu, where he told American diplomats that Bo’s wife, Gu Kailai, had killed British businessman Neil Heywood.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

lead_paragraph: A once powerful Chongqing police official, Wang Lijun, is accused of defection, abuse of power and corruption, China’s state media reported.
